messages.subject: Re:Frugal homeschooling links
messages.msgSnippet: Hey Frugalite ! Thanks for the Frugal homeschool links. That sounds more like what I have interests in, anyway. Helen, maybe you could split this into three
messages.messageBody:
Hey Frugalite !

Thanks for the Frugal homeschool links. That sounds more like what I have interests in, anyway.

Helen, maybe you could split this into three groups: the "Sandra-un-ego-school", the "Sandra-ites" list and the "Kyla-Kayla-Kyle-Krista-Kirsten-Skye-I'm O.K - You're a soccer brat" list......

<BG> and goodbye to all.

Dan C.

>>>>>>>>>>>
>Message: 17
> Date: Sun, 18 Nov 2001 19:14:16 -0000
> From: frugalite@...
>Subject: 2 frugal living yahoo groups!
>
>Hello there,
>
>I have 2 frugal living yahoo groups for any that might be interested:

>FRUGAL LIFE - a group dedicated to general frugal living. Any
>recipes, hints, or ideas I find on beauty, household cleaning,
>stationery, baby needs, any frugal living area - I'll share! Anyone
>else can also share anything they've found!!

>To subscribe:
>http://groups.yahoo.com/group/frugal_life

>FRUGAL HOMESCHOOLING - a group dedicated to free homeschooling
>resources: printables (unit study covers, book labels, eg.), ideas,
>information on theme studies, sites that are great. Anyone can share
>their ideas, and sites, etc. too!

>To subscribe:
>http://groups.yahoo.com/group/frugal_homeschooling

>Thanks for listening!

>frugalite
>>>>>>>>>>>





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
